{/* First Period Stories Section */}

My First Period Stories

{/* Left Box - Personal Experience */}

My First Period Experience

It was during the month of Navaratri, just after the Diwali celebrations had ended. One fine day, I noticed something unusual on my clothes. Confused and scared, I didnâ€™t know what was happening. Afraid of how my mom might react, I quietly hid the stained clothes under the old washing cloths and went to school, trying to pretend like everything was normal.

But moms always know. She noticed the hidden clothes and, understanding what had happened, rushed to my school. She brought me back home, her face filled with concern and care. I remember her explaining things to me, though at that time, I was too young to fully grasp it all. Being in just the 5th grade, I followed her instructions like a robot, doing as she said without really understanding why.

It was only years later that I truly understood what had happened that dayâ€”on 11th November 2014â€”and the significance of it. What felt like confusion and fear back then, I now recognize as a natural and beautiful phase of growing up.

{/* Right Box - Period Journey */}

My Period Journey: Embracing Strength and Resilience

As of today, Iâ€™ve completed 124 months of my period journey, with just one cycle missed along the way. Each month brought its own set of challenges, especially with the terrible stomach and back pain I often experienced. Yet, I never let it stop me. No matter how intense the discomfort, I pushed through my daily tasks, proving to myself time and again that resilience is a part of who I am.

My mom has always been my greatest support. She introduced me to simple yet effective home remedies that became my saviors during those tough daysâ€”like boiled coriander seeds (dhaniyalu) and a comforting mix of jaggery with ghee. These not only helped ease my pain but also made me feel cared for in the most nurturing way. I also found that staying hydrated and consuming more liquids rather than solid foods made a big difference in how I felt.

My period typically lasts for three days with a moderate flow, during which I lose around 30-60 milliliters of bloodâ€”roughly 2-4 spoons. In the early days, the sight of blood made me nervous, but over time, it became a symbol of my strength. Each cycle reminded me that women are incredibly powerfulâ€”we nurture, we endure, and we build communities with compassion and strength.

This journey has taught me that embracing every part of our experiences, even the painful ones, makes us stronger. Itâ€™s a reminder that being a woman means carrying a strength that is both silent and profound.

{/* Organic Pads Section */}

Organic Pads & Production

Arunachalam Muruganantham: India's Menstrual Man

Arunachalam Muruganantham revolutionized menstrual hygiene in India by inventing low-cost sanitary pad-making machines. Motivated by his concern for his wife's health, he faced societal stigma and personal challenges but persevered. His innovation empowered women by enabling them to produce affordable, hygienic pads, significantly improving menstrual health awareness and accessibility in rural India.

Muruganantham's work not only transformed the lives of millions but also sparked conversations about menstrual health, breaking long-held taboos and inspiring innovation in the field of women's health and hygiene.

Learn more about his journey {/* Image */}
{/* Menstrual Man Section */}

Menstrual Man

A. Muruganantham created affordable sanitary solutions for rural India

Choosing the Best Period Product: A Simple Guide for Every Lifestyle

Best for Beginners

  • Pads â€“ Easy to use, no insertion required, and ideal for getting started.

Best for Active Lifestyles (like swimming or sports)

  • Tampons â€“ Comfortable, discreet, and stay in place during movement.
  • Menstrual Cups â€“ Long-lasting and leak-proof for up to 12 hours.

Best for Heavy Flow

  • Menstrual Cups â€“ Hold more than tampons or pads and last longer.
  • Menstrual Discs â€“ Also great for heavy flow and can last up to 12 hours.

Best for Eco-Friendly and Budget-Friendly

  • Menstrual Cups â€“ Reusable for up to 10 years.
  • Reusable Pads â€“ Washable and long-lasting.
  • Reusable Period Underwear â€“ Sustainable and comfortable.

Best for Overnight Protection

  • Overnight Pads â€“ Extra length and absorbency.
  • Period Underwear â€“ Comfortable and leak-proof for all-night wear.
  • Menstrual Cups â€“ Can stay in place safely for 12 hours.

Best for Mess-Free Intimacy

  • Menstrual Discs â€“ Can be worn during sex without mess.

Delhi Student's Innovation

{/* Text Content */}

Eco-Friendly Sanitary Pads from Banana Fiber

A group of innovative students from Delhi developed eco-friendly sanitary pads made from banana fiber, offering a sustainable and biodegradable solution for menstrual hygiene. This initiative not only promotes environmental awareness but also contributes to accessible and affordable menstrual health products.

Their innovation has inspired local communities to embrace sustainable practices in menstrual health, encouraging a shift towards eco-conscious living.

Learn more about their product {/* Key Points Paragraph */}

Only 18% of women in India have access to proper menstrual hygiene, with many still using traditional materials like ash, coconut husk, sand, cow dung, or cotton cloth. To promote healthier and eco-friendly choices, women are encouraged to switch to reusable or biodegradable sanitary napkins. Banana fiber pads are a great option, offering excellent absorption, hygiene, easy washing, and quick drying.
